channel.title: I need some help plz!
channel.description: ok...xp basically screwed me over, and when i got done formmatting it, (~1 min ago) i can get the grub loader to boot, and let me go to Xubuntu. any suggestions because it took me forever to get where i am and i cant just start over...well, actually i can, but i don't want to. soo plz help me.

item.title: I need some help plz!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:6, topic:96594”][quote author=deoxys505 link=topic=139251.msg1354147#msg1354147 date=1179774958]

[quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=139251.msg1348287#msg1348287 date=1179680826]

Install windows, THEN xubuntu.
[/quote]lol… i did but had to reformat xp, then linux was still working, but i couldn’t access it. anyway, i put in my Xubuntu cd and it let me reinstall the grub loader,but thx for ur suggestion.

Yeah but windows has been known to mess up the boot-menu.
[/quote]i think it is because the way the grub loader is installed, it installs to the master record which is on the windows partition. when you format, aka. delete and erase everything, it destroys the grub loader and you have to hold on to your linux install Cd.

It’s not always that, it’s just installing xp sometimes messes up so you can’t boot into whatever,[/quote]

If that happens, use the install/boot CD to boot into your own filesystem (either append root=, or boot up and then use chroot) and then re-run grub.

Read full topic

item.title: I need some help plz!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“deoxys505, post:5, topic:96594”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=139251.msg1348287#msg1348287 date=1179680826]

[quote author=deoxys505 link=topic=139251.msg1342416#msg1342416 date=1179610728]

Install windows, THEN xubuntu.
[/quote]lol… i did but had to reformat xp, then linux was still working, but i couldn’t access it. anyway, i put in my Xubuntu cd and it let me reinstall the grub loader,but thx for ur suggestion.

Yeah but windows has been known to mess up the boot-menu.
[/quote]i think it is because the way the grub loader is installed, it installs to the master record which is on the windows partition. when you format, aka. delete and erase everything, it destroys the grub loader and you have to hold on to your linux install Cd.[/quote]

It’s not always that, it’s just installing xp sometimes messes up so you can’t boot into whatever,

Read full topic

item.title: I need some help plz!
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:4, topic:96594”][quote author=deoxys505 link=topic=139251.msg1342416#msg1342416 date=1179610728]

Install windows, THEN xubuntu.
[/quote]lol… i did but had to reformat xp, then linux was still working, but i couldn’t access it. anyway, i put in my Xubuntu cd and it let me reinstall the grub loader,but thx for ur suggestion.

Yeah but windows has been known to mess up the boot-menu.[/quote]i think it is because the way the grub loader is installed, it installs to the master record which is on the windows partition. when you format, aka. delete and erase everything, it destroys the grub loader and you have to hold on to your linux install Cd.

P.S. is there anyway to make my computer boot windows as the default for a reset or shutdown instead of the linux partition? Most of the time i restart, i need to boot into windows, and it gets to be a pain in the rear when i restart and cant watch my computer to change the start up O.S.

Read full topic
